channel.title: Vv on Data Science with R and Python
channel.description: Recent content in Vv on Data Science with R and Python

item.title: Subseting Daily Time Series Data Using Data.Table Package
item.description: This blog post shows how to get the beginning (end) of the month (year) observations from daily time series data. In my dissertation, I needed to calculate monthly returns and get the book-value and the market-value of the last day of June and December for different firms to construct Fama-French three-factor model. The easiest way I found to achieve this is through the code shown in this post. The prerequisite for this short tutorial is to be familiar with data.
